Do yourself a favour and rent and learn to ride a motorbike if you're staying in the area for more than a day or so. Otherwise various types of taxis are your best bet, but they're not easy to find.

value: directions=inland off Chao Fah Tawan Tok Rd (Rte 4021), about 4 km north of the Chalong Circle. Turn is signposted.

content=Huge white marble Buddha image visible from much of the island. 45 m tall and nearly as wide, it's one of the larger seated Buddhas in Thailand, if not the world. Seated on the highest point on the island it commands spectacular views and is accessible via a fun 6 km drive up the mountain.

: This area of Phuket, Chalong and Rawai especially is home to almost a dozen muay Thai gyms. If you're interested in a one day lesson or a six month training stint, it's a good place to look. Two gyms below, but there are at least half a dozen more within a 4 km radius.

value: address=15 Moo 1, Chao Fah Rd, Chalong
price=11,000 (fan)-14,500 (air-con) baht per month with lodging, 3,000 baht per week, or 9,500 per month without lodging

content=Somewhat smaller and cosier gym, very family feel. The gym can host about 40-50 students. Trainers are solid, all of the direct training is 1 on 1. The place is very cheap relative to many gyms and has a lot of perks including a private swimming pool, and a muay Thai stadium that hosts weekly matches which students can watch for free. In-camp restaurant is very good and affordable. Motorbike rentals are also available to students.
content=Much larger gym, caters more heavily to foreigners. Facility is massive and very new.
content=Fitness, detox, weight loss and muay Thai training holidays.

Most of the better places to get food are local spots. They tend to be cheaper and better than anything geared towards Westerners.  However, there are several cheap guest house/restaurants along Ta Lat Rd just off Rte 4021.

value: directions=middle of Ta Lat, opposite Tony's down a little side road, has a sign on the main road.
content=Open-air restaurant, not too crowded usually. Prices/portions are good, the Thai food is better than the Western food.
directions=middle of Ta Lat Rd, just look for signs.
content=Open-air restaurant that gets very busy due to the large number of muay Thai gyms in the area. Prices are affordable, the Thai food is better than the Western food.

Since you're in this area rather than in Patong, you're already much safer. It's a very safe place in general. Be aware of traffic, exercise common sense and be aware of swimming conditions if you're here in the off season as they are mostly likely unsafe.
